info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:47PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Madison, northeastern Buncombe and southwestern Yancey Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 247 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Burnsville, or 8 miles west of Mount Mitchell State Park. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mount Mitchell State Park, Mars Hill, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, Barnardsville, Faust and Swiss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
